page.title: 01 KINGSWEAR
page.content: { Kingswear}is a small village situated amidst spectacular scenery at the mouth of the River Dart opposite Dartmouth. The main industry of the region is centred around farming,tourism and watersports although there is significant crab fishing in the area. In the past{Kingswear}was an important terminal for the Great Western Railway.This line is now privately owned and links Kingswear and Paignton. {Kingswear}is linked to Dartmouth by a passenger ferry and a car ferry. There is a large Yachting Marina situated alongside the railway station. A small castle dates from Tudor times and the village church dates from the 12th century.
